column4: nobody here who can help with catching error messages from apt-get (aptitude) ? :-)
I think you can just run your apt-get (aptitude) > filename.txt

i do not want to do apt-get into file i want to write an installation script the problem is if the package does not exist and i set more than one package to be installed the one that does not exist does not install but all the others do
so how can i get this error message i get alway 0 as result
